column1: Reutov (Russian: Ре́утов) is a town in Moscow Oblast
The exact date of Reutov's foundation is unknown; however
column2: most historians believe that it was founded between 1492 and 1495. In the 17th-18th centuries
column3: the village of Reutovo belonged to the dynasties of Prince Turenin and Prince Vasily Dolgorukov. At the beginning of the 18th century
column4: Reutovo became a village. Census Book of 1709 has a record of the village of Reutovo
column5: owned by the Prince Vasily Dolgorukov.

column2: the village was acquired by Prince N. I. Maslov. Under his rule Reutovo became a luxurious country estate. At the beginning of the 19th century
column3: Prince Maslov went bankrupt and the village became a property of Lt. Col. A. M. Pokhvistnev who in 1824 built a cotton mill. Yarn from the factory was among the best in Russia and won a gold medal at the All-Russian National Show in 1831. Shortly after that Pokhvistnev sold the land and the mill.

column2: the land and the cotton mill was purchased by S. A. Mazurin
column3: a Moscow merchant. He built a brick factory
column5: and restructured the cotton mill gradually forming a factory town of Reutovo.

column2: Reutov is the host for NPO Mashinostroyeniya
column3: formerly known as USSR Experimental Design Bureau #52
column4: where development of various robotic and manned space satellites
column6: cruise missiles takes place; the longtime director was Vladimir Chelomey.The town is separated from Moscow by the Moscow Ring Road and Nosovikhinskoye Highway. Reutov has the status of a science-town (naukograd) and celebrates its anniversary on the last Saturday of September.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as Reutov Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: Reutov Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction is incorporated as Reutov Urban Okrug.

column1: Unlike in other cities and towns of Moscow Oblast
column2: public transport is fully serviced by Mosgortrans (State unitary company "Moscow city transport") but always without suburban fare. The only 28 bus is serviced by Balashikha. The transports connect

column1: From the west: to metro Novogireyevo
From the south: with districts Novokosino
From the north: to metro Pervomayskaya

column2: 5 stops (approx 20 mins) by commuter train (elektrichka) from Moscow Kursky Rail Terminal.
7 stations from the centre of Moscow city.
